cont.entity_a: Initially great non-stick and easy to clean, but coating peels off after a few years. Non-stick coating peels off even with minimal use. Non-stick surface efficient, but requires careful maintenance to avoid damage. Non-stick coating starts to come off within months.
Not durable; non-stick coating peels off even with minimal use. Inexpensive price but quality issues over time. Cookware works well on various stove types but has durability issues.
cont.entity_b: Great starter set; durable and easy to clean. Can withstand regular use without significant wear. Good value for the price but not as durable as expected.

cont.entity_a: Not all pieces work on induction cooktops. Good for induction cooking, but some pieces are not compatible.
cont.entity_b: Heat distribution is less efficient compared to other materials.

cont.entity_a: Some issues with size and fit of lids for frying pans.
cont.entity_b: Handles stay cool; lids fit well.

cont.entity_a: Heavy and well-made, but some handles get hot.
cont.entity_b: Heavy and high-quality with a lifetime guarantee.

cont.entity_a: Handles are comfortable, and cookware is weighty, but exterior scratches easily.
cont.entity_b: Welded handles prevent loosening. Handles stay cool.

cont.entity_a: Some pots and pans do not work on certain induction cooktops.
cont.entity_b: Not suitable for high heat; food sticks easily.
Stainless steel requires careful use to avoid food sticking. Some discoloration and spots can occur after use.
